Game Development

Libraries and Frameworks

for when you want a code-first view of your game

Implemented in Python

Python Arcade

Kivy

A Python framework more for application development, but has a lot of material related to game development.

Kivy: Cross-platform Python Framework for GUI apps Development

pyglet

General purpose cross-platform windowing and multimedia library for Python

pyglet Documentation — pyglet v2.0.10

DragonRuby

2D game library for Ruby

DragonRuby | DragonRuby

DragonRuby projects by brettcodes

Introduction - Building Games with DragonRuby

Recipes | Dragon Riders Community

GitHub - DragonRidersUnite/scale: Framework with conventions and utils for DragonRuby Game Toolkit

Gosu

A 2D game development library for Ruby and C++, with bindings for Crystal

Hello • Gosu

Phaser

Make Web games with JavaScript

Phaser - A fast, fun and free open source HTML5 game framework

Pixel

2D game framework for Go

GitHub - gopxl/pixel

Pygame

Engines

A lot of overlap with libraries, but the idea is that these focus more on the tools than on the code.

Microstudio Game Engine

learning

Defold Engine

Wicked Engine

Flax Engine

Falco Engine

No-code Engines

Microsoft Make Code Arcade

learning

GDevelop Engine

Tools

Streamlines a particular aspect of the workflow, though not generally something you can make a whole game with.

Tilesetter - Tileset generator & map editor tool

Tiled | Flexible level editor

Tiled Documentation — Tiled 1.10.2 documentation

GitHub - blurymind/tilemap-editor: TileMap Editor is a fat-free tile map editor with zero dependencies and a scalable, mobile-friendly interface

LDtk – 2D level editor

Learning LDtk – LDtk

JSON documentation – LDtk

Assets

Tiles, sprites, sounds, and other creative assets your game needs. itch.io has loads of free and low-cost asset packs.

Kenney Game Assets 1

Thousands of completely free game assets for you to use

Home · Kenney
